nodes.bodyText: Reusing tk here is not good here.  Say we get through this loop without tk being null, and then the check at line 204 is true.  This would result in a seek and we would immediately pop out of the outer while loop because tk is not null and would not be holding the correct field name!  Use a separate Key variable instead.

I wouldn't hold it up over this, and some could argue it's too esoteric, but it seems like this could actually be a good use of a labelled continue statement. Label the outer while loop, change this to continue <label> and remove the addition at line 202. At that point, nextTop could also be local to this loop.

This leads to an infinite loop if we never go in to the for loop on line 188/189 (which would happen if we already have the right key). All of the github actions have been stuck due to this. Initializing nextTop as Key nextTop = top; on line 187 will solve.
I'll have that fix up in a moment
